heif

Enum HeifBoxType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HeifBoxType>
      • heif.HeifBoxType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<HeifBoxType>

    public enum HeifBoxType
extends java.lang.Enum<HeifBoxType>
    Defines all supported HEIF (High Efficiency Image File) box types.

    Each HeifBoxType corresponds to a specific 4-character code used in the ISO Base Media File Format (ISOBMFF) and HEIF/HEIC specifications.

    Boxes are categorised as:

    • HeifBoxType.BoxCategory.BOX – Atomic data boxes containing fields
    • HeifBoxType.BoxCategory.CONTAINER – Structural boxes that contain child boxes
    • HeifBoxType.BoxCategory.UNDEFINED – Unknown or unhandled box types

    For official details, refer to:

    • ISO/IEC 14496-12:2015 (ISOBMFF)
    • ISO/IEC 23008-12:2017 (HEIF)

    Use getBoxType(String) or getBoxType(byte[]) to resolve box types at runtime.

    Since:
    17 June 2025
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • getBoxType

        public static HeifBoxType getBoxType(java.lang.String name)
        Resolves a HeifBoxType from a 4-character string.
        Parameters:
        name - the box type name (For example, "meta", "ftyp")
        Returns:
        the corresponding HeifBoxType, or UNKNOWN if not recognised

      • getBoxType

        public static HeifBoxType getBoxType(byte[] raw)
        Resolves a HeifBoxType from a 4-byte array.

        Comparison is performed using ASCII encoding.

        Parameters:
        raw - the 4-byte box identifier
        Returns:
        the corresponding HeifBoxType, or UNKNOWN if not recognised
